Reviews.Title: Very good all-around point and shoot
Reviews.Author: E. Woodbury "twoody"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently upgraded from our Sony DSC-P8 to a Sony DSC-W130.  So far we are extremely happy.  We shopped around quite a bit before settling on the new cybershot, and spent a good deal of time trying out other brands.  In the end, the Smile Shutter brought us back to Sony.  It sounds like there is no way it would work, but it really does.  We have two young children that are remarkably hard to catch smiling.  With the new Sony, all we have to do is turn on the smile shutter and the camera does the rest.  So far, we haven't missed a smile with the 3 year (with teeth) and have caught a few of the 4 month old (no teeth).  It makes a difference.The other feature that has been great so far is the burst mode.  With my old camera, the missing time between shot resulted in a lot of blurring.  The new camera manages to focus each shot much better.  We played around with some moving targets, and the pictures came out great.  One major drawback of burst mode, however, is that you can't use flash.  I took a bunch of pictures indoors and the quality was ok, but not great.  The flash just turns off when you switch to burst mode.The video recording is great on this camera.  Obviously not camcorder quality or anything, but very good for what you'd expect from a point and shoot.  The sound quality still isn't that great, but much much better from my older camera.  It seems like it balances the audio in the first few seconds.  If the first few seconds are loud, the whole video will be softer.  If you start out soft, however, you bury the needle when it gets lounder leading to some distortion.  You also can't zoom while in video mode - something they don't tell you.The flash recharges after about 1-2 seconds, which is great.  It also is pretty effective for long distances.I like the menu configurations, especially now that I've had some time to play with them.Picture quality is great, but I'm upgrading from a 2MP camera, so it probably wouldn't take too much to wow me.  We took a ton of shots and were impressed at the level of detail when we zoomed in on our computer.Overall, we are very happy with this camera.  It has some limitations and problems, but for the money (and for being a point and shoot) it is great.

Reviews.Title: Shopped around; would buy it again; but be aware of minor issues
Reviews.Author: Garrett Cook
Reviews.Content: Just bought this new from a local retailer.  Did a lot of research online comparing this model to some of Canon's compact cameras.  I'm not a photography buff so I wanted something that was small and not necessarily the "best" but would still take nice pictures.  I really like the features that it includes.  The 4x zoom is greater than most at this price point, and even some more expensive cameras.  Seems to have a lot of neat features, like the Smart Zoom (digital zoom without pixelation), multiple auto focus points, and ability to shoot 640x480 video.  The face detection is pretty cool and seems to work really well.  I thought about getting the DSC-W130 with its 8MP resolution and editing features, but figured that 8MP was more than I needed and I'd rather do my photo editing on the computer.One or two "bugs" I'm aware of:1. If you shoot using burst mode, you'll find that you can't turn the flash back on in any mode but Easy mode.  You have to reset the camera back to factory defaults to shoot using the flash again.  Even knowing this I would still buy the camera, but I'm hoping that enough people would alert Sony to this error to release a firmware update to fix it.  Otherwise I would have given it five stars.2. When you plug in the camera with the USB cable and turn it on the lens will open and then close, so be sure not to leave it face down before transferring data.3. This camera (unlike some) does not receive power through the USB cable so it needs to have a battery with charge in order to transfer pictures.  Don't leave it on too long while it's plugged in or it'll drain the battery.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Deanoism
Reviews.Content: It's just about perfect, for me. Of course, I'd like the quality and control of an SLR in a tiny package, but for something this portable it does a fine job. The onscreen descriptions of the settings are just fantastic, the ISO (low light) mode has to be seen to be believed...very little noise, even without flash. Pictures are mostly sharp, though without flash you still have to maintain a steady hand, as with any camera. Very balanced and realistic color. It's a very intuitive camera that lets you concentrate on your composition and not worry too much about exposure, which I think is what a small point and shoot should give you. I also love the 16x9 modes for stills, haven't done any video with it. I'd recommend getting a clear shield to stick on the screen, like I did...seems very scratchable otherwise. If I lost it I'd probably get the same camera again. I'm pretty conservative with my reviews, I'm sure many people would give this an unabashed 5 stars, and I almost did, but you still get the occasional surprise when you shoot something that should have turned out fine but didn't for some reason....I think it's just where the tech is at right now, but this camera rocks, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: B. Moore "romeo6"
Reviews.Content: I also own a Sony A700 but it is a big camera to lug around all the time. I wanted something small that I could throw in my purse to carry all the time. This camera is wonderful. I get great shots in all kinds of light, the pictures are clear, close-ups are amazing, it's fast and the battery lasts a long time. The only thing that I would change to make it even better, is more optical zoom.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs!
Reviews.Author: R. Owens
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a smaller camera that would take good quality pictures, especially on trips.  I take college students abroad for a month in Costa Rica and wanted to be able to do a blog with lots of pictures to record their experiences.  This camera far exceeded my expectations!  It is extremely simple to operate.  I have been able to figure out features that are new to me on the fly without having to refer to the manual.  Particularly impressive to me are the video capabilities and the high sensitivity / low light with no flash setting.  I have been able to take excellent shots in dark museums where no flash is allowed and have been able to upload good-quality videos to the blog.  The software that comes with the camera works well and is very user-friendly.  The 4X optical zoom is not powerful enough to take fine nature photographs from great distances, but it is good enough to zoom in to compose a picture for most general purposes.  All in all, I highly recommend this camera, especially for travel.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: SesameStick
Reviews.Content: Its all you want in a point and shoot.  I can turn it on, not even look in the screen, push the button and get good in focus-properly light pictures.  Is very thin, good button lay out.  Only hit of a negative with it is the port to connect to the computer is on the bottom, would prefer it on the side, still a strong five stars.

Reviews.Title: Fast, fast shutter
Reviews.Author: Holly Lewis "Free-Range Librarian"
Reviews.Content: I've been in love with the Carl Zeiss lenses for years now, but my older Sony digital had such a slow shutter I was missing pics of my son. This camera takes really fast pictures!!! I also love the setting that allows me to force the camera to focus on a childs face before anything else in the frame. The blue color is stylish, and its small enough to fit in a front pocket. Looks great in a Kroo Camera Case Premium Quality Carrying Case for Sony Cyber-shot + Bonus Bundled with Universal LCD Screen Protector Kit + Cloth in light blue.

Reviews.Title: Nice Pictures
Reviews.Author: Felicia D. Schmeltzer "picture fanatic"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera becuase I was going on a cruise to Bermuda.  Never owning a sony before I crossed my fingers.  I am so happy with this camera.  It took such beautiful clear shots, motion shots were fuzzy but for the most part every picture I took was more outstanding then the next one.  Easy to use, I bought a 4gb memory card and had over 1000 pictures I could take.  I took 400 pictures and I am happy with them.  This is a good camera and a good buy.  I am a sony customer for life.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Mjordan23
Reviews.Content: Before purchasing the Sony Cybershot DSCW120 I owned a Fujifilm digital camera. The camera was all around a good camera, but the pictures weren't as clear as I wanted them and it was a little bulky. Then I lost the battery and really wasn't sure if i wanted to spend the money to purchase a new one.Then last week, I went onto Amazon and looked at camera's and got interested in buying a new Camera. Since I wanted something light, small, preferably black, takes clear pictures, and good reviews, I came across this Sony Cybershot. After reading all the review (which im a first review, then buy person) I was Sold. The next day I went to Circuit City and purchased the Camera, a case, screen protector, and of the course the $30 dollar memory card.I took it home, turned it on and just started snapping pictures. The pictures were clear as day, even in low lighting areas. I tried using the Face Smile setting, which was a little confusing in the beginning, but after playing around, was actually really cool.Another thing that I love is that when slidding the wheel, like when going to  auto, face smile, video, etc, tells you what each setting is.Example: When turing the wheel to Twilight is says "shoot low light scene using tripod". I think this is an awesome setting when turning the wheel and not really know what your turning to and have to either play around or resorting to the manual.Overall I think this is an awesome camera thats light, a pocket size, and shoots crisp clear pictures. For the 200 dollars I spent, I cannot be happier.

Reviews.Title: awesome purchase
Reviews.Author: B. Elkins
Reviews.Content: this was a great investment.  I got that package deal (camera,case,&duo; stick for computer) at a better price than Sony or Best Buy offered. Camera has really great features (auto smile, set to look for adults or children, video, & slideshow to name a few).  The only downside is that Sony has not made a Marine Kit to fit this camera yet for underwater use. Excellent quality on printed pictures.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding compact camera
Reviews.Author: rpowell7 "Bob"
Reviews.Content: I brought my new DSCCW120/B on a trip to Europe and it took hundreds of excellent photos.  The ISO (no flash, low light) mode was very handy inside cathedrals and I found the landscape (far focus) mode easy to shoot through screens and still keep distant focus.  My spouse (of unsteady hands) was grateful that the Steady Shot feature captured almost all of her photos in good focus.  The fact that I could drop it in my front shirt pocket without feeling it was very liberating.  Yes, it did fall on the pavement several times due to bending over, but no damage was inflicted.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Abby Kay "Abby Kay"
Reviews.Content: Got this just before a trip to Utah.  Very compact, easy to use.  A 4G memory stick holds about 1500 pictures.  The OEM battery lasted a week and 600 pictures.  Can't beat it.  Also got one of those "gumby" mini tripods at Wal Mart for $10.  It's about 8" long with flexible legs.  Highly recommended as well.

Reviews.Title: A little bit of a let down.
Reviews.Author: M. Fielder
Reviews.Content: This is a great looking camera and a nice size.  I was replacing my aging panasonic camera and hoping that the pictures would be noticeably better, especially with double the mega pixels and dual antishake.  But the pictures were very similar to my older camera and the antishake didn't seem to work at all.  It may be that I didn't keep the camera long enough to figure out the best settings or that I got a defective one but I did return it and bought a Canon Elph instead.  It's a SD850is and takes great pictures and was about the same price as the Sony.  The canon has a flimsy plastic cover over the usb port that keeps popping open so I guess there is no perfect point and shoot but the pictures are very good and the digital macro lets you get as close as you possibly can.

Reviews.Title: Very fast and efficient, almost error proof.
Reviews.Author: Michael Byrne "TallandFrothy"
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera about 9 hours ago and am very happy with it. I also own a sony camera with a carl zeiss lens that is about 4 years old. that camera has held up very well  and has given me some amazing pictures. when i saw this it reminded me of my older sony and has a lot of the same features and qualities.when you take a picture with most older cameras you have to hold the camera very still and breathe gently or your result will be blurry. with this camera you can probably be jogging and still take a clear picture.there isn't any fuzz or discoloration between pixels (like some other 7 megapixel cameras have) and its light settings are awesome.i would recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for a very high quality pictures without having to have any experience in photography.and if you do have quite a bit of experience with photography (like i do) then it makes the job a lot easier for macro, low light, and bright conditions.

Reviews.Title: Excellent teensy camera
Reviews.Author: Alice W. Ward
Reviews.Content: I may be the least ept photographer in the world. I have long sought a very small digital camera with automatic settings that even I could understand. Sadly I have a number of cameras that did not fit this requirement. This camera fits the bill perfectly. It has a view finder in addition to the focus frame, another thing that I wanted. I'm a lot more successful with a view finder than trying to center something in the focus frame. The picture quality is excellent and I have had no problem using it. Given my lack of eptness, this is an amazing thing. I highly recommend this little treasure.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: Tanya Andrade
Reviews.Content: I already had a sony cybershot and took great pictures. As it became older, the lenses would not open or close. I decided to purchase another camera. Due to the great quality pictures I had taken with my old sony, I decided to purchase a new cybershot and found this product to be a good value for its quality. I do feel that the batteries are very expensive in comparison to my previous one.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Jessica Darling
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing! I love how big the screen is on the back and I also love how fast it takes the pictures! This is a very nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for price
Reviews.Author: Charles Little
Reviews.Content: Wanted a camera that used the pro duo card (which I can put in my Sony TV for a slide show).  Just got back from Disney with the family--great pictures, easy to use-am buying one for my daughter who is getting married!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Larry Pfau
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera.  Has lots of great features and takes excellent pictures.  The movie capturing ability is also excellent with great sound reception.  Make sure that you get a memory stick because the internal memory can only hold 5 pictures.  I got the 4gb memory stick and can now hold 1290 pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality Pictures, Isn't this what you want in a camera?
Reviews.Author: Gork5000"
Reviews.Content: I am a professional photographer and I have used many cameras. I own a few point-n-shoots because they are easier to use and they function fine for most applications. But the quality of my previous digital cameras aren't any where near the quality of this camera. The DSCW120 focuses amazingly well. I tried zooming in on an image of a cat and each hair was crystal clear, even in medium to low light. This is a leap year ahead of the Sanyo point-n-shoot camera I own, which is awful at quick autofocusing.I would recommend this camera to people wanting high quality for a reasonable rate. The only issues I have with this camera is that it takes a proprietary battery. It would have been much better if they used AA or AAA batteries instead. This camera also uses a "Duo/PRO Duo Card", a very small memory card, not the SD cards which are cheaper, easier to find, and are just as fast.All in all, I give this camera a 4.5 out of 5 stars. If it used AA batteries and an SD card I would give it a perfect 5.I wish camera manufacturers would listen to me!

Reviews.Title: Great Quality Pictures, Isn't this what you want in a camera?
Reviews.Author: Gork5000"
Reviews.Content: I am a professional photographer and I have used many cameras. I own a few point-n-shoots because they are easier to use and they function fine for most applications. But the quality of my previous digital cameras aren't any where near the quality of this camera. The DSCW120 focuses amazingly well. I tried zooming in on an image of a cat and each hair was crystal clear, even in medium to low light. This is a leap year ahead of the Sanyo point-n-shoot camera I own, which is awful at quick autofocusing.I would recommend this camera to people wanting high quality for a reasonable rate. The only issues I have with this camera is that it takes a proprietary battery. It would have been much better if they used AA or AAA batteries instead. This camera also uses a "Duo/PRO Duo Card", a very small memory card, not the SD cards which are cheaper, easier to find, and are just as fast.All in all, I give this camera a 4.5 out of 5 stars. If it used AA batteries and an SD card I would give it a perfect 5.I wish camera manufacturers would listen to me!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera with Proprietary Accessories
Reviews.Author: American Trevor
Reviews.Content: We needed a smaller camera that would fit in your pocket/purse when we didn't want to lug around the DSLR.  This camera has had great reviews, and so far has not disappointed.  Takes great shots, very quickly with very long battery life.  Face detection is top notch, although "Smile Recognition" has limited usefulness as group shots can be affected by one person not smiling, or people have to smile unnaturally overemphasized to get it to kick in (you can adjust the threshold, but it still is rarely natural looking).The only problems with this camera so far is the fact that Sony continues to force it's users to use proprietary everything.  From the batteries, to the memory, to the cable to plug into your computer, nothing is off the shelf and everthing is expensive to replace.  No AAA's, USB cables or CF cards here (which are cheap and plentiful).  But besides that, a very good camera.

Reviews.Title: Good point an shoot from Sony!!!!
Reviews.Author: LFGD1978 "The Shopaholic"
Reviews.Content: I love the point an shoot cameras made by Sony mainly because of the Professional Carl Zeiss Vario-Tessar lens, that makes a huge difference when you compare this camera to a similar price camera from another manufacturer, in my opinion the picture quality of this camera is far superior then HP, Canon, Olympus, or Nikon.Sony include the new ultra fast BIONZ processor in all their new cameras, this is a big deal when you take high resolution pictures and want your camera to be ready to shoot the next in no time at all.There's a lot of things I love about this camera like: the animated graphical menus, cool metal exterior finish, big display, slide show with or without music, extended battery life, high sensitivity of ISO 3200, Super SteadyShot, and Convenient Photo Modes among others.The Smile Shutter Mode does work but its a bit tricky when you try to use it on several subjects since you have to detect everyone faces for the Smile Shutter to work properly and this is not as easy as it sounds.Overall I recommend this camera to everyone who likes a small size point an shoot, easy to use, that can take great quality pictures without spending too much money.

Reviews.Title: At least it was CHEAP
Reviews.Author: Jon H. "average user"
Reviews.Content: We wanted a simple point and shoot camera to get snaps of the grandkids.  It had to be easy to operate, we don't have time to be messing with menus and adjustments.  I have an old Fuji 2600, an 8-year old 2MP camera, that has done a good job, but lately has been showing its age.I read a few professional reviews that said the DSC-W120 had better-than-average shutter lag for a pocket camera.  With that, and a good price, we bought the Sony, and we've used it for about 10 months.When operating indoors using the flash, the camera is way slow, even with the red-eye OFF, the flash set to always ON, and the camera pre-focused (shutter button pressed halfway).  There is still a long delay before the image is captured.  By that time the subject has moved or the expression is gone.I've read other reviews where they use the burst mode to overcome this problem, but that doesn't work for flash photography.The W120 has better low-light performance than my Fuji, but only because of the ability to push the ISO setting and the AF-assist light. But the Sony is no better for indoor pictures, unless the subject is still.The Sony has many more bells and whistles, some of which work. The face recognition works.  The smile detection works only occasionally.Outdoors, the camera performs pretty well, as expected with a 7.2MP imaging chip. But I was still disappointed with the speed, as it was little or no improvement over my old camera.In summary:Pros:-Inexpensive-Lots of controls for those who need them-Good for still portraits-Battery life, good for more than 100 shots with about 50% using flashCons:-Very slow shutter lag when used with flashOverall, this camera has been disappointing.  Even with all of the features, the slow shutter lag is a real show-stopper.  With so many advances in the technology, there must be a point & shoot that is faster than this.

Reviews.Title: The ideal consumer digital camera.
Reviews.Author: Brian Ward
Reviews.Content: If I wanted a better camera than this one, I'd start looking at digital SLRs. The photos seem to come out perfect in any lighting conditions, even a dark smokey bar on New Year's! The smile-detect mode is the coolest thing I've ever seen a camera do, and it works really well.The design is great too. It's small enough that it's actually portable, and that includes the charger too. It's tough enough for the real world. It starts up super fast and feels comfortable in my hand. Best of all, it takes great pictures every time.I've been loyal to the Cybershot family since my first digital camera, and for good reason. I've never been disappointed by them, but this is by far the best one I've seen yet.

Reviews.Title: Nice!!
Reviews.Author: Shire-mum
Reviews.Content: Cool little camera! Bought for our 13 year old, he loves it! Easy to use, nice pic's, does videos too! Can't go wrong with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Not worth the mone
Reviews.Author: Tiki Paul
Reviews.Content: While this camera has an impressive collection of features (albeit few useful ones), the quality of the photo it takes turned out to be very poor.  We didn't expect it to be as good as the Nikon D50, 6MP SLR we purchased two years ago, but even on full quality this "7.2MP" camera's pictures were worse than a five year old 2MP camera we have.  Needless to say, we were very disappointed with this camera and returned it.  We have since purchased a Panasonic FS3.  It also offers a wide range of obscure features that we will never use, but it takes considerably better pictures in lower light situations than the Sony.  It doesn't have the 4X optical zoom like the Sony, but we'll gladly give up a bit of zoom for added quality.  The increased MP, 8.1 vs 7.2, makes up for a bit of the zoom.  And considering the premium we had to pay for a Memory Stick vs a simple SD card, the overall cost was the same.We have always been a Sony family for video recorders and cameras, TVs, portable stereos and game systems, but have never liked their digital cameras since the days of the Mavica and the early Cybershots.  We were just hoping they had figured out what they were doing wrong, but when it comes to digital cameras, it is obvious Sony is counting on their brand name and styling to win over customers and hope they will be satisfied with what they get in the way of image quality.We can only suggest you go to a store where you can get your hands on demo units that are charged and take some test pictures.  When you review them, use the zoom feature to closely examine the image quality.  Everything looks sharp on the little display screen, but once you zoom in or put the image on a larger screen you will be able to compare the quality of the different cameras side by side.

Reviews.Title: A Nice camera but not for everybody
Reviews.Author: Jose Melendez Ruiz
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera{I got the Blue version that is prettier}This camera takes very nice pictures but If you're looking for something kind of professional Then this one is not for you.This is a simple camera for someone who will upload pictures to Facebook, Windows Live Spaces or My Space and will print some pictures. This is not like the Sony Cybershot W300 that is 13.6 Megapixels, This one is a nice camera for simple use.I am still getting used to it because it's kind of complicated to handle but still I feel I will use this camera a long time...

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Gerhart Hauptman-diaz
Reviews.Content: This product has been through hell and still has worked. The battery life is great and takes great photos and video.

Reviews.Title: easy to use, great quality
Reviews.Author: B. Stanley
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's very easy to use. When others use it to take a picture for me they have no problem. There's no additional explanation required when I give it to them.I also love the "EZ" mode. It takes really good photos at night without flash. This is the first time my night photos haven't been bleached out by a flash.

Reviews.Title: Not As Expected
Reviews.Author: JonH
Reviews.Content: Purchased from a discount store via Amazon. Delivery was timely. When the box was opened, it looked like it had been opened before, although everything was there.  A short while after, I noticed a stuck pixel on the display.  I guess that was why it was discounted.If conditions are right, the pictures are excellent. By right, I mean the subject must be holding still and the lighting must be good.Shutter lag is a problem, especially trying to get shots of grandkids.  Reviews I had read said that this camera was faster than average for point-and-shoot cameras, but I've got much older digicams that are at least as fast.  The flash is also slow, kids tend to move before it finally makes the shot.I can't say much good about the smile feature - good luck getting someone to smile hard enough to trigger it, then hold still long enough for the image to be captured.Low light performance is okay.  The image stabilization helps, although not as much as I expected.Focusing - there are multiple focus zones, and the camera may focus on the background instead of on the intended subject.  Pre-focusing works, but with moving subjects there isn't always time to do that.Finally, the battery discharges faster than expected.  If we shoot a lot of photos all at once it seems to hold up okay.  But if we can take a few shots on a fully charged battery, then let the camera sit for several days, turn it on again and the battery is half gone.  Should it discharge if the camera is off?Overall, not a great camera.  But it is a good cheap camera.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Ashwini Aragam
Reviews.Content: While travelling at Salt Lake City, I was compelled to buy a camera. The surroundings demanded me to take them home, well at least as pictures. I was looking out for Digital camera for some time as our old Fuji 4100 was a bit bulky to carry on a business trip. I didn't want to spend too much money on the camera. I didn't want a SLR, that was too much for me both in terms of money, involvement and care. I just wanted to snap shots and I could get good pictures that is pretty much all I needed.Of course, I started with Consumer reports. I didn't want the tiniest ones; these introduce quite a bit of shake during the shots. The compact ones listed the DSC-W170 as a best buy. The W300 was what I ideally wanted, but about $300 wasn't what I wanted to spend. At SLC, I hopped around Walmarts, Bestbuys, Targets but couldn't find any of the DSC-Ws. These take wide angle shots, good for landscape pictures. I guess this model range is going out and will probably be replaced by a newer range. Hence, it was a tough search.Finally, an Office Depot had the W120 and W150. I settled for the W120. The camera itself is about 3.5" x 2.25", which makes it easier to drop it into the shirt pocket. It has a built in flash and a view finder. Now a view finder is very important as in bright light, the LCD panel gets washed out and you can't see well what you want to snap. It also has a 4x Optical zoom. Consumer reports says you should have at least 3x Optical zoom. And it produces 7.2 Megapixels photos. Yes, it is not 15 MP, but 7.2 is good enough for 10x8 prints; by the way I never print photos now-a-days. We only view it on the screen. It also has a smile shutter, that I haven't tried. There are other loads of features - you can connect the camera to a HD TV and the camera somehow manages to show a great picture on the big screen. Consumer Reports said that worked well; I haven't tried that. See, I just need a functional good camera to snap the moment and get decent pictures. You have many modes preset such as portrait, twilight (this is neat), soft focus (only subject is sharp, rest is blurred), self timer, 2 (or more) second delay so that it eliminates the shake introduced by pressing the button.The battery is meant for the camera i.e., you can't use AA/AAA batteries. The small size of the battery makes the whole camera small. The charger is neat, you can plug the charger right into the outlet without long wires hanging. After the charging, you can snap the charger's prongs? back into the casing, making it easier to carry along on a trip. The Optical stabilization (Super Steady Shot, as Sony calls it) should be good, as I haven't noticed any shake in the pictures I took, given the size of the camera.You can view back the pictures as a slide show on the LCD panel and also play some music, if that is what you want. So far I have taken over 200 pictures and am quite happy with the camera. I read that there are some software bugs that prop up (some macro error), but haven't seen that yet. Hopefully, I don't ever.You can connect the camera to your computer's USB drive and transfer pictures directly without any special software, thought the camera comes with Sony's own picture organizer and viewer. The camera requires the Memory Pro stick card, which is slightly more expensive than your typical SD cards. If you connect to the computer with the secondary memory on, you won't see the built-in memory card. You have to remove the memory stick pro to access the internal memory.On the rush to go to the mountains, I had to pick up a 2 GB MSP for about twenty two bucks, but if you plan ahead you can find a 4GB for a little less on the Internet. The built in memory is good enough for about 15 pictures at lower resolution. The menu is extensive and hence not exactly simple; given the vast amount of features, it is hard to make it a simpler one, I guess.Overall for about $130 I paid for the camera ($22 for the additional memory), I am very satisfied with it. You can view the pictures I took at Picasa - [...]

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera!
Reviews.Author: Wei Chen
Reviews.Content: This camera has all the features I wanted: easy to use, long battery life, and it's not expensive.

Reviews.Title: Definitely good for the value.
Reviews.Author: T. Marble "Movie fan"
Reviews.Content: I got this for $109, and based on that price, this camera is a wonderful bargain. At the MSRP price of $179, I'd much rather go with a Canon for a few dollars more.Pros:  Small size (perfect for pocket), huge display, solid construction.Face & Smile recognition is a FANTASTIC feature, and steadyshot is a blessing for my wife.cons: Small buttons, deleting pictures is a multi-step process involving menus, 4GB Sony memory cards is 5X the price of 4GB SD cards. All the steadyshot & smile features drain the battery VERY fast.

Reviews.Title: Trust The Raving Reviews -- I'm Glad I Did!
Reviews.Author: Avid Reviewer "A Music Fan"
Reviews.Content: I've been hankering for one of these sleek, compact, and handsome Cybershots for a long time. The main reason I had held out on getting it was the fact that it uses Sony's proprietary Memory Stick instead of the ubiquitous SD card, which would allow for the easy transfer of data to most devices. I finally caved when the price of both the Cybershot and Memory Stick dropped.[Update: There's actually a microSD to Memory Stick Pro Duo Adapter now that converts a microSD card to a Memory Stick Pro Duo. (Transcend and PhotoFast both make it.) I got one (supposedly made by Kingston) from eBay that works flawlessly with a Kingston microSD card, which comes pre-formatted. Now, I'm able to use the microSD card on the Sony Cybershot using the "microSD card to a Memory Stick Pro Duo adapter" *AND* on all the devices that take microSD cards -- with no compatibility problems! I'm so glad Sony FINALLY opened up their proprietary Memory Stick format. I'm pumped!]The 7.2 megapixel resolution is plenty for making sharp 8 x 10 prints. I am just utterly amazed at how much detail this camera captures. The pictures are amazingly sharp and the colors look true. The huge 2.5-inch TFT LCD display is a definite plus and make accurately framing your pictures a cinch. The screen is bright, so the on-screen menu and images can be easily seen even in bright sunlight.The camera also does audio/videos at a high 30 fps frame rate. The resolution on videos is a measly 640 x 480, so when the videos are played in full screen on your monitor, they look slightly grainy. Still, the quality is decent enough and it's a nice little extra to have since this is not a dedicated camcorder.The placement of the buttons on the camera and the on-screen menu navigation is very user-friendly and intuitive.I can't give this Sony Cybershot enough praise. There's yet so many more features and functions to explore. This "toy" has given me hours of fun snapping random pictures and marveling at the captured images. The only regret I have is having waited so long before I took the plunge. If you're sitting on the fence, you should go ahead and get this! Trust all the raving reviews about the Sony Cybershot (DSCW120)-- I'm glad I did!

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot is too good
Reviews.Author: Aritra Bandyopadhyay "Aritra"
Reviews.Content: This product bought from Amazon is the perfect thing if you are not such an expert photographer but still wish to click some great pics. Very easy to use and portable to carry almost anywhere.This is also the first product that I bought from Amazon and the best price I could get.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera w/lots of features
Reviews.Author: G. Bernatz
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed by the small size, reasonable price, and big features of this camera. I like the way it adjusts for movement (either subject's or user's). Very user-friendly-- I like the on-screen info when using features. Love the generous size of the screen. Battery life is decent. As a beginner, I can say this camera makes my pics look professional. It's a keeper.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money, few lil' things would do differently...
Reviews.Author: Dimitar Blagoev "D.Blagoev"
Reviews.Content: We have purchased this camera about a month ago and as of now we like it.  The compact size makes it easy to carry around, it has a large screen and the 4x zoom comes handy. And the most important thing - it takes great pictures for a point and shoot cam.The only thing that I don't care too much is the zoom button.  I would have kept it together with the shoot button instead of moving it to the back with the rest of the controls.  But that's just me, I guess.And another wish of mine for the Sony people - put a designated video button - it's so handy if you are shooting a lot of videos.  Especially since the video this camera takes is as good as any regular video cam that I have messed with...  And let us zoom in and out while we shoot videos - it's probably not very hard to do...July 2009.  We have used the camera for a while now, it still works well.  One thing that we found out is that in Auto setting it gets confused when you have a dark and well lighted spots on the same shot - like shooting a face with side light on it.  Then the lighted side gets overexposed and basically white.  Not too good.  I found out that this is common for Sony cameras, even for the expensive once.  My friend just got rid of his because of this...  Maybe there is a way to deal with it in other modes, but who wants to mess with that..

Reviews.Title: low price. valuable
Reviews.Author: Hiro
Reviews.Content: it is replaced Sony W80. Image quality is better than W80. In Particular supersensitive picture(i.e. ISO800) is better than W80. And low price is good.

Reviews.Title: Love my product. Very fast shipping
Reviews.Author: SERENITY 30
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is so easy to use and it is amazing. It takes high quality photos and I love it much more than my Canon PowerShot A400.

Reviews.Title: Awesome point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Y. Shaul
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 12 year old duaghter, she used it several times and the pictures are just amazing, she doesn't have to do any manual adjustments, just point and shoot, and most of the pictures are ready for print. The only issue I see is a common issue to all non-DSLR cameras and it's the lighting conditions - when taking pictures at night the pictures are often blurry with no option to fix them.

Reviews.Title: GREAT DEAL!!!
Reviews.Author: A. Muller
Reviews.Content: I've had the DSC-W55 before and decided to buy this model. It's really nice. Love the quality of pictures. Very easy- to- use camera, specially made for starters. And the memory stick duo adaptor... great idea!The bad thing.... if you have big fingers, you are gonna have a little problem with the buttons of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice and stylish
Reviews.Author: Rosalba Patiño Ordaz "Rosalba Patiño"
Reviews.Content: The Sony Cybershot DSCW120 is very stylish, lightweight and slim. It is very easy to use and the smile-shutter is a very fun feature. Too bad you cannot zoom-in/zoom-out while shooting a video.

Reviews.Title: Sony cybershot DSCW120 is a must have...
Reviews.Author: L. lockhart "PrettySmyle"
Reviews.Content: I have had the Sony Cybersot for about two months now. I owned a previous model of the Sony Cybershot that I absolutely loved. unfortunately It fell out of my purse and crash to the ground. It was never the same. But din't get me wrong that was the last of thusands of crashes... That was just the final one.So I automatically set out to get another. First off I loved that I had a choice of colors (Pink, Black, Silver & Blue). Of coarse I chose the pink... Thing that I hated most was the music. It took me a while to figure out how to cut that annoying feature off. InstantlyI was not a fan of the menu... I had to actually break down and use the manual... For me that is virtually unheard of!!! & Believe me I am embarassed to actually admitt this fact... lolOk back to the Sony Cybershot. I purchased this camera for the Smile Shutter technology. It captures smiles the moment they happen - without having to press shutter. The mode can be set to capture when your subject laughs, smiles or even grins. It also has Face Detection function is able to differentiate children and adults to set priority.With this camera I actually take better pictures in poor lighing. It takes fabulous pictures in normal lighting. There has been several occasions that I have used my camera and my pictures have been requested the most...I am also very pleased that the screen in the rear of the camera is huge and clear as a bell. In poor lighting you can't see very well but that is expected. Once you take enough pictures you will be able to capture whatever your heart desires.7.2-megapixel gives you more detail and definition whenever you need big prints or for tight cropping. The advanced Sony Super HAD (Hole Accumulated Diode) CCD design allows more light to pass to each pixel, increasing sensitivity and reducing noise. So Bad lighting situations are ideal for this camera.Carl Zeiss 4x Optical Zoom Lens is great for sharp, detailed long shots and quickly frame images for better composition -- great for family sports, outdoor fun, and travel photos.I love this camera and for about $179 this is a perfect gift...for more reviews NewLifeFromWisdom . com

Reviews.Title: Love this
Reviews.Author: Melisa L. Olivero
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera fro my trip to Paris and I was thrilled with the quality, speed, battery, and size. This was a great value.LOVE LOVE LOVED IT

Reviews.Title: Camera Stopped Working and Horrible Customer Service
Reviews.Author: H. Dewey
Reviews.Content: I have now purchased 2 Sony cameras but will never buy from them again.I had this Cybershot camera, and started having problems with it after 6 months.  The camera would turn on, but the picture was black.  Everytime I would take a picture it would also be black.  I used their tech support over the phone and two times they were able to walk me through the problem to solve it.  When I asked if I would need to buy the extended warranty they said no  since it was a re-occurring problem.Now my camera is out of warranty, and they are no longer able to walk me through how to fix it over the phone.  Instead they want to charge me $111 just for labor to take a look at the camera and that doesn't include a price for any parts needed.  When I called customer service they said there is nothing that they could do about the problem and that I would just have to pay to have it fixed.  (Not to mention I could buy a new camera for the same price off of Amazon.)IT seems like this is now there way of making money.I will never buy another Sony product, and I hope this doesn't happen to you.  Beware, their customer service is only there to help you when it serves them, but magically they can't fix the problem over the phone anymore when it will benefit them financially not to do so.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot with a Viewfinder Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Ryback
Reviews.Content: Everyone forgets that this little camera has a viewfinder.  That's my main reason for choosing this camera along with the fact that it takes good pictures w/o a flash in places that don't allow flash, i.e. museums, concerts (when you are sneaking in a camera that is).Oh and the audio for the vids is  very good (it's a SONY!) it should be.  Only thing about the vids is that once you zoom it in at the start of the vid, you cannot change it, must remain at that setting for rest of vid.

Reviews.Title: used camera
Reviews.Author: Margarita
Reviews.Content: I bought this used camera as a gift.  I owned this same camera and wanted another Sonythat had the easy to use dial system that is no longer found on cameras.  The camera came with all the originalpackaging. The recipient of the gift has to take pictures of student art  work i at the spur of the moment and finds this camera works really well.  Was also shipped very promptly.

Reviews.Title: Incredible pictures and very affordable
Reviews.Author: S. Carlson
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of cameras out now with far higher megapixel ratings than this one, but it still takes some outstanding photos and is very easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Beats lugging around a big camera
Reviews.Author: Alexis Razon
Reviews.Content: I bought the pink version of this for my wife a few months back when it was only around $120. It's great for taking random pictures and doing casual photography. The only thing I hate about this (and Sony in general) is its proprietary cable, memory stick and battery. I loved the Sony H2 because it uses standard AA batteries and mini-USB. This model uses non-standard cables and battery. So when I lost the cable, I had to use either the H2 or a separate card reader to transfer files to my computer.But it takes great pictures--which is the most important thing for cameras.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Jack Foote
Reviews.Content: We have had several of this model camera and all have performed well.  However, the newer Sony models do not have a viewfinder which means that photographers can't see in bright light.  It seems that after this camera, we will need to purchase a Canon.

Reviews.Title: nice but buy a memory card
Reviews.Author: Beachmom "lovingmyboys"
Reviews.Content: This is nice camera. Small and takes good pictures.  Just BEWARE if you don't have a memory card this camera only holds 5 pictures on the internal memory!!  I picked this camera up kind of in a rush and thought I would have room on the inter. memory for 20-30 pictures, thought wrong.  Other than that it is a nice camera, good enough until I get my DSLR! ;)

Reviews.Title: Horrible quality of pictures
Reviews.Author: N. Haymes
Reviews.Content: I got this camera after upgrading from a Kodak Easyshare 4.0 (which I loved) and I am so disapointed with the quality of pictures. It only takes nice pictures if you outside or in a very well lit area. Also, if your subject even moves the slightest bit, the pictures are blurry. I am really disapointed with the colors in the pictures. I had to set it to vivid color just to capture some brighter pictures. The colors are very dull and washed out. My Kodak Easyshare camera took way better pictures than this. I am very dispointed in this Sony product.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber Shot 4X is great!  2nd time I've reviewed this product.
Reviews.Author: jgat "Jgat"
Reviews.Content: This is the second email request for a review that I have answered.The camera is great and the order and shipping were flawless.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: This little camera has it all
Reviews.Author: Alf
Reviews.Content: Everything I was looking for in a compact camera at this great price--Zeiss lens--4x optical zoon--just enough mp for me--lots of photo/setting options: auto, manual (b&w;, sepia, no flash, low light, tungsten, iso, smaller size for email...) This camera remembers my manual settings until I change them.--you may adjust length of time to view newly-taken photos in lcd display before camera is ready to take another shot--zoom feature for newly-taken shots in lcd display--no blur with "no shake" option on--large lcd display--compact and lightweight--comes w/battery charger--comes w/cords to upload to computer or tv-- and... takes great pics/color for internet or for clear prints up to 11x17"The only thing I can't find is a way to turn the sound (beeps when shooting, etc.) completely off.

Reviews.Title: My Niece Loves This Camera
Reviews.Author: Eric Gagnon
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera as a Christmas gift for my niece and she really loves it. She had another pink slim camera made by another maker that she was always complaining that the batteries ran out too quickly. This Sony model has a long battery life and it's also rechargeable so that's particularly nice. I spoke to my niece yesterday and asked if she was using it and she said "all the time" and "I couldn't imagine life without it" lol

Reviews.Title: good point and shoot features
Reviews.Author: Q. C. Davis
Reviews.Content: Feature-packed small point and shoot includes an important feature  not found on most point and shoots--a viewfinder. The viewfinder makes it easier to see details in any light while composing your picture, and allows you to hold camera steadier than when viewing the screen at arms length. Among its many features, also has two other nice touches: face detection, and "smile shutter" which detects your subject's smile and takes the picture. Carl Zeiss optics are a quality touch in a camera in this price range, and noise reduction feature helps clean up images in long exposures.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot-Great camera / Bad Bundle
Reviews.Author: We Love Amazon.com "Please ship to APO"
Reviews.Content: The Sony Cybershot W-120 takes great pictures and is a wonderful first camera for our 17year old.  The case that we received is not what is shown in the picture...it is black, trimmed in pink, with no way to attach it to her purse or belt loop.  This does NOT come with the mini SD card (that is shown in the picture next to the memory stick) that you will need in order to take more than 5 pictures.  So order one in addition to this so that you can use your camera right away.  The camera charges quickly and is very easy to use right out of the box (except for the memory card ;p ). I would order this camera again, but NOT this bundle.  Choose a case separately so that you know exactly what you'll be receiving.Sony Cyber-shot DSCW120MDG/P 7.2 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom with Super Steady Shot (Pink) with LCS-TWE/PI Carrying Case and MSRW-MD1/P Memory Stick Duo Adaptor

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: mark twain "keylargo2"
Reviews.Content: I just recently purchased this camera and so far, I have no complaints. I have had Sony digital cameras in the past, so I was not surprised at the picture quality. It is as good you're going to find in this megapixel rating or price range. Easy to use right out of the box. It is also a nice looking camera ( I believe the black stands out more than the other colors. ) As for as Sony, I have owned several of their products ( CPU, TV, etc. ), and their product support is as good as anyone out there. They build quality products and they stand behind them. That's really all you can ask for. I highly recommend the camera. For the average consumer, a 7.2 MP rated camera is all you need. Buy a 2 or 4GB memory stick and a bag. You'll need them. 4GB will get you over 1000 high quality shots.

Reviews.Title: Ok camera, but not good under low light conditions
Reviews.Author: Khanh B. Nguyen "bookdaddy"
Reviews.Content: I did not buy the camera on Amazon, but have been a Sony Cybershot user for a long time. My wife really like the design of the camera and how portable it is. It takes nice picture in most conditions. However, we found it highly frustrating under low-light conditions. The pictures either come out blurred because of long exposure time, or strangely lit.

Reviews.Title: Helena's Sony Cybershot Camera - My lifesaver!
Reviews.Author: H. M. E. Gustavsson "Helena - The Swedish Girl"
Reviews.Content: I simply love this new camera.It has so many new features that I love. Like the smile shutter.It can also take great pictures at night which my previous camera wasn't so good at. I highly recommend this camera. Go and buy it if you want a great quality camera but don't feel that you want to spend a fortune on it!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jim McGiveron  http://nosmokejim.blogspot.com...
Reviews.Content: Sony has been around for a long time,and they have a great reputation,allmy stereo components are Sony.This Sony camera is compact,lightweight,and takes great photos.I bit more zoom would be nice,but,the overall performance is awsome.

Reviews.Title: affordable
Reviews.Author: erwin
Reviews.Content: i bought it for only $138.51, it's a good price deal. the digicam is nice. it has everything that i wanted. have one!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Zubair
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera recently & i must say i do like it very much. The main reason i chose this camera is the HD feature, cause i have a 47inch Sony LCD, so i can watch the pics & vids on it.The smile feature is pretty decent, The price is not too bad. Have fun with it.

Reviews.Title: great photos
Reviews.Author: C. Walker
Reviews.Content: This camera took great photos right out of the box.  Just point and shoot.  It's controls were simple enough for my tech illeterate fiance to document getting ready for our wedding, and then our honeymoon to spain.  It didn't matter what time of day or night or the lighting conditions, the camera took beautifull pictures that rivaled my SLR.  The smile function was interesting, aperantly you need a $100 smile to get the camera to snap your photo, but was a nice try on the engineers part.  Very small and easy to put into a purse or even a pocket and not weight you down.  Great camera.

Reviews.Title: I love sony but I hate this camera
Reviews.Author: lisamaybehere
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I love my DSc-S85 cybershot that I got about 8 years ago. What a let down this new cybershot has been. It's really hard to to take anything but still-life shots without blur. I missed so many wonderful photos because of this. To top off my frustrations, the thing just quite working after about 4 months. One day when I turned it on, the lens popped in and out a few times, then I got an error message saying to turn the camera off and on again. It did this over and over again, and I've never been able to use the camera since. LAME.

Reviews.Title: Sony W 120
Reviews.Author: Phyllis A. Love "ajabba"
Reviews.Content: I've always purchased Sony digital cameras until earlier this year when I purchased my first d-SLR.  Due to the SLR's bulky size, I wanted another camera to carry at all times in my purse.  I purchased this camera with high hopes for great pictures and ease of use.  The ease of use is awesome.  Quality of pictures is something else.  They're okay but nothing spectacular.  Blown up in Photoshop, I am sadly disappointed.  My Sony camera that I purchased 2 cameras before this one took much better pictures.  (last one being an H1 and the one before that being an F717)  In fact the F717 still amazes me with its picture quality (at 5MP).  Both the H1 and the F717 were quite a bit more expensive and had better sensors and lens but I figured since it had been at least 3 and 5 years since those cameras were new, that the W120 would be comparable.  I thought maybe my expectations were a little unrealistic because I was accustomed to my SLR.  But---I have compared the W120 to the F717 and there is just no comparison.  Hands down, the 5+ year old F717 beats the W120 at any shooting situation.My last gripe about the W120 is the download cable.  What is this?  Why can't it use some type of a standard cable?  I finally gave my W120 to my daughter who comes home only about every 2 weeks.  She likes to download her pics to our computer but the last time, she forgot her cable.  I have almost every download cable that's available but not that "special" one.  Wait---oh, yeah, I'll use a card reader.  Oh, wait---I can't find the adaptor for the pro duo card.  Now that's a dilemma.  Come on, Sony, make downloading a little easier.  Simplicity would have been nice here.I give it 3 stars because it is handy and has some great features on it, but I think picture quality and the download situation could be better.

Reviews.Title: Great product!!!
Reviews.Author: baucha "baucha"
Reviews.Content: This is simply a great point and shoot camera. I purchased this for my wife and she is very happy with it. The ease of use and the quality of picture are incomparable. Face detection technology and smile shutter are really wonderful but sincerely they are not very much useful. Overall I recommend this product to everyone who want a good point n shoot camera in low price.

Reviews.Title: You can't go wrong with the Sony Cybershot Series!
Reviews.Author: DJ Come of Age "DJ COA"
